L7p:Comment.stringValue: === If you have the need to customize this policy
=== please contact CA APIM Support so we can improve customization capability
=== This policy creates the social login provider web site.
=== It will add the icons to the authorization servers web site.
=== Or, if requested, it will return the icons only without any other parts of the authorization web site.

L7p:value.stringValue: In this case the requestor is the ssg itself and does not need to display the social login buttons

L7p:Comment.stringValue: ============ Create page for Desktop browser or Mobile SSO SDK ============

L7p:value.stringValue: Check, if 'display' is empty or set to 'page'

L7p:Comment.stringValue: === Important: each enabled provider has to be configured within its own folder:

L7p:Regex.L7p:Replacement:
Sign in using one of the following:

${socialProviderForm}

L7p:Comment.stringValue: === The given device hasn't been registered: enable all IDP
=== The given device has been registered, but the domain is empty: enable SDK login dialog only
=== The given device has been registered, but the domain is set: enable the IDP of given domain only

L7p:value.stringValue: Enable - disable: set the flag "enterprise" which will cause the SDK to set the login dialog to enabled/ disabled
A key used by the client to poll for an authorization code
The Mobile SDK needs at least an empty JSON reponse even if social login is disabled
Social login only as JSON message
Generate the correct response per requesting client-type
